instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00875: What is 820-00875? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Anyone have a source for 2016-2017 MacBook Pro LCD connectors?
threads.message: I have a blown up <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LCD connector. Haven't been able to find a replacement. Anyone know of a source?

threads.title: Anyone have a source for 2016-2017 MacBook Pro LCD connectors?
threads.message: Not yet. If you have a 00239 board, you can take off the "life boat" connector J9600. It is not needed unless you want data off a dead board. You will need to bridge all the pins together, look at diagram.

threads.title: Anyone have a source for 2016-2017 MacBook Pro LCD connectors?
threads.message: Ahh, perfect, I have some of those. Thanks.

threads.title: Anyone have a source for 2016-2017 MacBook Pro LCD connectors?
threads.message: Uhm, if you have scrap 00239 boards there are 2 of them on there. The LCD connector is the same and the life boat connector.

threads.title: Anyone have a source for 2016-2017 MacBook Pro LCD connectors?
threads.message: Not scrap, but I'll steal the J9600s from some I'm working on.

threads.title: Anyone have a source for 2016-2017 MacBook Pro LCD connectors?
threads.message: Known that you will need to bridge all the connections together left to right or the SSD will not work anymore of course.

threads.title: Anyone have a source for 2016-2017 MacBook Pro LCD connectors?
threads.message: Ok, I'll look at that. Thanks for the tip.

threads.title: Anyone have a source for 2016-2017 MacBook Pro LCD connectors?
threads.message: So I pulled an LCD connector off of my newly allocated <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> donor board and I have backlight again. I'm measuring a very low .059 in diode mode on pin 14 <SIGNAL>BKLT_PWM_TCON2MLB</SIGNAL>. It should be somewhere around .735. Pin 16 <SIGNAL>BKLT_PWM_MLB2TCON</SIGNAL> is fine at .735. Any idea how this might affect things? Also, do you think it's necessary to put the surrounding grounded metal ring back on the LCD connector? It's working without it so far but I'm not sure of the consequences of leaving this off.

threads.title: Anyone have a source for 2016-2017 MacBook Pro LCD connectors?
threads.message:
Probably won't have brightness control anymore. The only reason I can see for the low reading would be a damaged SMC. 
Dunno about the shielding, you're probably fine there.

threads.title: Anyone have a source for 2016-2017 MacBook Pro LCD connectors?
Anyone have a source for 2016-2017 MacBook Pro LCD connectors?
threads.message: So, brightness controls are working normally, but video is going away at times. It's not like a bad connection in-and-out kind of thing, it just won't have video after coming out of sleep, or restarting. Just now I disconnected the battery and restarted it and the video is back. Not sure what I'm dealing with yet.

threads.title: Anyone have a source for 2016-2017 MacBook Pro LCD connectors?
threads.message: Ok,  yeah, can't come out of sleep. Screen is just backlit, but no video. Computer is still working in background though.

threads.title: Anyone have a source for 2016-2017 MacBook Pro LCD connectors?
Anyone have a source for 2016-2017 MacBook Pro LCD connectors?
threads.message:
That seems like a good time.

Thanks for the tips.

threads.title: Anyone have a source for 2016-2017 MacBook Pro LCD connectors?
threads.message: So this board will actually lose video signal randomly. I thought it was only when coming out of sleep, but it happens at random times and stays off until I restart, and sometimes doesn't even come back then. It will however show up fine on an external monitor during those times. The backlight is on. The screen has the same blue/black glow as when you first start it, but with nothing on the screen. Any idea which line might be dying to cause the signal to go out like this?

threads.title: Anyone have a source for 2016-2017 MacBook Pro LCD connectors?
threads.message: [URL="https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/member/1-larossmann"]@larossmann[/URL] Can you take a look at this one for me. The title is a little confusing because it started off as something else and evolved into an issue post. Feel free to change the title to something better. Thanks

threads.title: Anyone have a source for 2016-2017 MacBook Pro LCD connectors?
threads.message:
Have you confirmed with a known good LCD that this still happens? 

Also the LCD in these has a 5v and a 3.3v power rail, unlike the old ones that only had 5v, or 3.3v exclusively. When this occurs, are you missing power on one, neither, or both?

99% chance it is the LCD. If it managed to blow up the LCD connector then it isn't a large jump that the LCD itself went bad as well. I realize that these are incredibly expensive so keeping a donor around is painful.
